host_templates.alias: Template to check Linux server using SNMP protocol
host_templates.name: OS-Linux-SNMP

information.author: Centreon
information.changelog: Same pack but generated with the new system of plugin pack export

description.value:
Plugin pack to monitor GNU/Linux operating system using SNMP protocole.
Several indicators are available but not linked to the template of host.
You have to use them manually:
* CPU usage
* CPU detailed usage
* Disk-Global (all disk, by name, by ID)
* Disk I/O
* Global Inodes
* Load usage (1m, 5m, 15m)
* Memory usage
* Packets error (all interfaces, by name, by ID)
* Process state
* Swap usage
* Traffic (Bandwidth usage for all interfaces, by name, by ID)
* TCP connection
* Uptime

* Etat d\'un processus
* Utilisation du SWAP
* Trafic (Utilisation de la bande passante pour toutes les interfaces, par nom ou par id)
* TCP connexion
* Uptime

information.monitoring_procedure:
#Prerequisites Be sure to have with you the following information: * Read-Only SNMP community * IP Address of the equipment ## Configure SNMP on your server Follow constructor procedure for your equipment. ##SNMP Permissions Read-Only access. ##Troubleshooting Read [Troubleshooting SNMP](https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon-plugins/en/latest/user/guide.html#snmp) #Centreon Configuration ##Create a host using the appropriate template Go to "Configuration > Hosts" menu and click on "Add" button. Then, fill the form as shown by the following table:
FieldValue
Host nameName of the host
AliasHost description
IPHost IP Address
Monitored fromMonitoring Poller to use
Host Multiple TemplatesOS-Linux-SNMP
Click on the Save button.
information.name: Linux SNMP
